entry.title: ShortFinal Design KLAX for XP12 Updated to V2
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. ShortFinal Design (SFD) has updated KLAX to V2. This is the first update since 2020, and it includes numerous changes. Los Angeles International Airport (KLAX), with its four runways, served 75 million travellers in 2023. This makes it the second-largest airport in the US and one of the worldâs busiest airports in terms of both arrivals and departures. â According to SFD, the most notable update in version 2 is the introduction of native support for X-Plane 12. This allows for a variety of enhancements, such as 3D vegetation, dynamic airport vehicles equipped with FMOD sounds, and native rain effects. Users of X-Plane 11 will also benefit from updated hangars and terminals, as well as significant structures like the SoFi Stadium and the LAX Automated People Mover. Furthermore, the update enhances textures and lighting, improves various structures, and streamlines animations through LST integration. â The full list of changes is as follows: â Version 2.0 (December 20th 2024): The update is free for all current owners of the scenery and is available for $26.95 on the x-plane.org store for those who do not already own it. Stay tuned to Threshold for news, reviews, and more. Additionally, join our vibrant community on Discord.

entry.title: FSLabs Updates A321Ceo for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. FSLabs recently issued a new update to their A321Ceo for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. The update addresses core functionality issues that were affecting a subset of users with their Simbrief, Pushover, Printer, and Techlog integrations, fixes several crash-to-desktop issues, provides additional System fixes, and more. Update v11.0.1.290 â the second in rapid succession since the productâs release in early December â is currently only available via the experimental channel, bringing the fixes mentioned above and adding hardware access to the FCU, EFIS, and glareshield, with an expansion planned over the coming weeks. Work with their industry partners to integrate the interface into their software is underway. The update highlights follow below: â FWC (F9C & F3P) ATSU/EFB/Techlog Systems Improvements: Exterior Model Updates: Sound Enhancements: Simconnect Hardware Based on user feedback, FSLabs is working on improving the sounds, which are expected to land in the experimental channel early next week. The add-on is available on their website for $69. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: xEnviro Version 1.34 Released
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. xEnviro has been updated to version 1.34, introducing new and reintroduced features to the environmental plugin. This update includes various new features and fixes, further polishing the plugin for X-Plane. The new update for X-Plane 12 introduces a range of enhancements. It includes adjustments for camera exposure and a bloom slider to improve visuals. Additionally, the update features improved weather effects, realistic lightning strikes, and reflections from city lights on the clouds and atmosphere. Light scattering has been refined for enhanced realism, and NVIDIA graphics cards in X-Plane 12 have received an anti-aliasing update. Enhancements have been made to cloud and shadow rendering, as well as to thunderstorm formation. Airport lights now function correctly at night. Haze effects and the white edges of clouds in mountainous regions have been addressed, and fixes have been implemented for Vulkan crashes. Additionally, a recent update has improved performance when minimizing windows. A full changelog of the new features, fixes and improvements can be found below: â Whatâs New: -X-Plane 12 Enhancements. -Camera exposure adjustments. -A new bloom slider for fine-tuning visuals. -Improved Weather Effects. -Lightning strikes with cloud-to-cloud and cloud-to-ground variations. -City lights reflecting on both the atmosphere and clouds. â Key Fixes & Improvements: -Light scattering adjustments for better realism. -Anti-aliasing fix for NVIDIA cards in X-Plane 12. -Multiple cloud and shadow rendering enhancements. -Fixed haze effects and cloud white edges in mountainous areas. -Vulkan crash fixes and improved performance when minimizing windows. -Airport lights reappearing properly at night. -Thunderstorm formation improvements. The team behind xEnviro is optimistic about the future, stating that this winter and spring, they expect to restore all the features that were temporarily removed during the transition to X-Plane 12. Additionally, they anticipate the introduction of new features.Â â While this update primarily focuses on X-Plane 12, the team confirms that compatibility with X-Plane 11 will still be maintained. They caution, however, that they cannot guarantee 100% compatibility, although it should function as intended for most users.Â â When asked about the duration of X-Plane 11 compatibility, Magnus indicated that it will remain partially or fully supported at least until all features currently removed due to the transition to X-Plane 12 are fully restored. The update is now available for download from xEnviro's website. If you do not yet own xEnviro, the team is excited to announce a temporary price reduction from $69.69 to $49.69 while they work on restoring all features. This is a great opportunity for anyone interested in trying xEnviro for the first time, and it can be found in our store. â With the update, the xEnviro team thanks everyone for their support and wishes everyone a happy holiday. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: LevelUP 737NG Series for XP12 Released
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. For years the freeware aircraft has been in development, but after two years it is finally ready for X-Plane 12. This release represents Update 1. The package includes all five members of the 737 Next Generation family. According to the LevelUp team, the release features brand new textures, reimagined cabins, and a modular visual architecture. It includes the full power of the ZiboMod, offering incredible visuals, realistic flight dynamics across four different fuselage lengths and an all-new CornUI Tablet interface. Additionally, the LevelUp team has partnered with Laminar Research and FlyJSim developer Daniela Rodriguez Careri to bring a symphonic audio experience. â The aircraft is available for free now on the Threshold forum! â Stay tuned to Threshold for news, reviews, and more. Additionally, join our vibrant community on Discord!

entry.title: MM Simulations Releases Oulu Airport for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. MM Simulations has recently launched its version of Oulu Airport (EFOU) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. This airport, located approximately 6.6 miles from the city center of Oulu, Finland, welcomes around 550.000 passengers each year and handles nearly 6.000 aircraft movements. The airport opened in 1953, following the commencement of construction in 1949. Initially, the airport featured only gravel runways. This changed in 1958 when the runways were paved, and the airport received its terminal and air traffic control (ATC) building. In 1973, the current terminal building replaced the earlier structure, which was later demolished in 2005. The terminal underwent further expansion and renovation in 2002 and 2011. Regarding the runways, the second runway was removed in 2000, shortly after the completion of the current ATC tower in 1998. Today, the airport operates flights from Finnair, Lufthansa, and Aegean Airlines, offering various regular and charter destinations, including Helsinki, Munich, Chania, and Rhodes. The scenery package is filled with features including custom night lighting, custom parking positions, custom surroundings, custom people, PBR materials, and much more. The add-on requires slightly over 1 GB of storage space and is available on SimMarket for $17.16. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: X-Codr Updates Sceneries for MSFS24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. X-Codr Designs have recently updated all of their MSFS20 sceneries for the MSFS24. The update focuses on compatibility with the newest simulator and will be completely free.Â â The Grand Canyon West Airport (1G4) has received many improvements, such as a fully remodelled skywalk bridge, texture improvements for the Skywalk complex, airport ground markings and airport facilities, an updated airport layout, and various other minor enhancements. This update is available for both MSFS20 and MSFS24 on Orbx, and will soon be available on the MSFS marketplace. The development update also mentioned that the West Yellowstone Airport has undergone a lot of changes in the past years: a new hangar, an expanded FBO, as well as a brand-new terminal set to open in 2025. Because of that, a free update containing all the changes will be released in 2025! â As the differences between MSFS24 and MSFS20 are quite considerable, there are still some issues with some sceneries. The list of issues can be found here. The last part of the development update also mentioned an upcoming airport for X-Plane, with a little sneak peek. If you have any ideas about which airport this might be, let us know in the comments down below! â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight sim news and reviews! â

entry.title: WinWing Launches MCDU/CDU Panels
entry.summary: Sim: OTHER. We now have more information about the WinWing MCDU and CDU panels announced this spring at FSWeekend and further showcased at FSExpo, thanks to a promotional video shared on their social media. The video showcases their new âMIP Series Airline Panelsâ lineup, which includes the previously mentioned A320 MCDU and 737 FMC, as well as two new additions: the 747 and 777 FMCs. After being a key player in the military flight simulation market, WinWing entered the commercial flight simulation market earlier this year with the A320 FCU, having big aspirations. WinWing says its new product line will feature a full-scale design aimed at delivering maximum authenticity, with a panel thickness of 28.5 mm. The panels will be fully backlit, and equipped with adjustable lighting and realistic light sensors. Their SimAppPro plug-and-play system will allow users to manually switch positions among captain, co-pilot, and observer roles, making the panels suitable for a variety of cockpit configurations. The video also shows mounting solutions that make the panels ideal for both desk setups and home cockpit builders. Each unit in the lineup costs the same, being priced at $129.95 before tax and shipping, with small price differences depending on currency exchange rates. â Stay tuned to Threshold for news, reviews, and more. Additionally, join our vibrant community on Discord!

entry.title: FSLabs Updates A321Ceo for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. FSLabs has released another update to their experimental branch for the newly released Airbus A321Ceo, addressing CTDs, further system fixes, extending hardware support, and more. Update v11.0.1.291 â the third since the productâs rollout in early December â brings improvements to the sound sets in the cockpit, mitigates an issue affecting a subset of users with a lot of add-on products in their community folder, and further refines its overall stability. It also extends hardware access to more EFIS and ECP events. The highlights for the update are below: DMC Systems Improvements: FWC:Â ATSU:Â Sound Enhancements: Simconnect Hardware FSLabs will continue the sound work through the holidays, as they are aware that some issues still exist. However, they wanted to provide part of the ongoing work with this update to gather feedback and eventually warrant a polished result. The add-on is available on their website for $69.95. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Airwil Sceneries Releases Iloilo International Airport for X-Plane 11 & 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Airwil Sceneries has recently launched its latest scenery for X-Plane 11 and X-Plane 12: Iloilo International Airport (RPVI). As the fifth busiest airport in the Philippines, Iloilo International Airport welcomes over 2.3 million passengers each year. Commercial traffic at the airport began in 2007, serving as a replacement for the former Mandurriao Airport. Although it did not operate as a commercial airport before 2007, the site of the current airport has been involved in various aviation activities since 1942. During World War II, an airfield was constructed in 1942. After the war, this airfield gradually transitioned into a civilian airport, accommodating both military and general aviation traffic. Over the years, the airport underwent several changes and construction projects before commencing commercial operations in 2007. â Today, the airport serves airlines such as Cebu Pacific and PAL Express, offering flights to destinations including Cebu, Manila, Singapore, Hong Kong, and many others. Airwil Sceneries' depiction of the airport boasts numerous features, including hundreds of custom-made objects, a modeled interior of the passenger terminal, a modeled interior of the control tower, and more. The scenery requires 1.99 GB of storage space and is now available at SimMarket for approximately $11.46. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: X-Plane 12.1.3 Released
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. X-Plane 12.1.3 has just been fully released, one and a half months after the first beta release. ATC, the user interface, and sounds are among the most improved aspects of this update. â ATC and sounds According to Laminar Research, the ATC system has undergone a significant overhaul. Radio communications have become much more realistic, including features such as radio checks, clearance requests, and VFR and IFR procedures that support SIDs and STARs. Additionally, the default navigation data has been updated to AIRAC 2306. Users can now copy and paste routes from tools like Navigraph and Simbrief directly into their flight plans. They can also request alternative SIDs and STARs, ask for altitude exceptions, and receive per-turn instructions. Furthermore, X-Plane can now be configured to output ATC audio to a separate audio device. Weather A full weather update is planned, but some changes have been made in version 12.1.3. Issues with sudden altitude and pressure changes during mid flight have been resolved. Additionally, improvements have been made to cloud visualization and interpreting METAR information and wind data. Errors related to the NEXRAD display for document number G1000 have also been addressed. User interface The flight configuration menu now provides more detailed information about gates and ramps. Additionally, the map highlights active runways and shows taxi routes. Several smaller improvements have also been made, including fixing rendering stutters that occurred when displaying UI elements and ensuring that VR windows maintain their positions. X-Plane identity In preparation for the X-Plane Store, the X-Plane identity feature has been released in early access. This feature allows you to link your purchase key to your X-Plane identity. Once you complete the migration, your X-Plane key will no longer be necessary; a simple login will grant you access to the simulator. In the future, purchases from the X-Plane Store will be linked to your X-Plane identity. According to Laminar Research, migrating to X-Plane identity is entirely optional. Several other changes have been implemented, including a handcrafted overhaul of The Downtown Manhattan Heliport (KJRB) and enhancements to the default A330, Cirrus SR22, and Cessna Citation X. â The full list of changes can be found on X-Plane.com. â Version 12.1.4, âThe Flightlessons Updateâ is next up. â For more on that, and more, stay tuned to Threshold. Additionally, join our vibrant community on Discord!

entry.title: MK Studios Publishes Development Update for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. MK Studios recently published a short development update concerning the status of their ongoing projects, future products, MSFS 2024 product compatibility, and finally, their new scenery in the Pacific Northwest. Their upcoming rendition of DÃ¼sseldorf Airport (EDDL) is coming along nicely, with a late Q1 2025 release date in mind. MK Studios has also shared four work-in-progress screenshots as an extra appetizer.Â Their next project, briefly mentioned last time as an airport in the Pacific Northwest, will be Seattle-Tacoma International (KSEA) in the United States. Helsinki and Rome Rebootedâthe new name for their V2sâare also progressing nicely and will be totally focused once they get DÃ¼sseldorf and Seattle out of the way. In the meantime, they are collecting pictures and data, and any help is greatly appreciated. â Regarding the new simulation platform, MK Studios is working on compatibility issues. Montreal and Dublin will soon receive an update that includes major fixes and improvements, with other airports to be updated in the coming months. They are trying to find a good balance between updating pre-existing products and developing new stuff, which is said to be a tricky task due to how unstable the new sim and SDK can be at times. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Brazil Land Games Releases FlorianÃ³polis International Airport V3 for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Brazil Land Games has recently released its rendition of FlorianÃ³polis âHercÃ­lio Luz International Airport (SBFL) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 (MSFS 2024 compatible). The airport serves FlorianÃ³polis, Santa Catarina, Brazil, and has a yearly average of 3.9 million passengers. It was initially built in the late 1920s as Campeche Field, and the French aviators of the Compagnie GÃ©nÃ©rale AÃ©ropostale used it for their operations to and from FlorianÃ³polis. In the 1940s, a proper runway and basic infrastructure (apron, control tower, and passenger terminal) were built. As the airport was shared with the Brazilian Air Force, some military infrastructure improvements were also made. The passenger terminal was rebuilt and modernized in the early 1950s and remained in use until the 1970s when a brand-new terminal was opened. The terminal was then expanded in the late 1980s and in 2000, reaching a total area of 8,700 square meters.Â In early 2017, Flughafen Zurich AG won a concession to operate and expand the airport, which kicked off shortly after in 2018. This included the construction of a new terminal with fourteen new gates, costing 570 million BRL. At the time, the main runway was also extended by 100 meters. Itâs served by AerolÃ­neas Argentinas, Azul Brazilian Airlines, Copa Airlines, Flybondi, Gol Linhas AÃ©reas, JetSmart Argentina, JetSmart Chile, LATAM Brasil, LATAM Chile, Paranair, Sky Airline, Sky Airline Peru, TAP Air Portugal, and Voepass. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with custom ground textures, custom jetways, an up-to-date ground layout, custom landside buildings, a custom terminal interior, and more. Itâs available on their website for roughly $8. Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight simulation news! â

entry.title: Taimodels Releases Orlando Sanford International Airport for MSFS 20/24 and X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Taimodels has recently released its rendition of Orlando Sanford International Airport (KSFB) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, as well as X-Plane 12. Located in Sanford, Florida, this airport serves as the secondary commercial airport for the Orlando area, alongside Orlando International Airport. Last year, nearly 3 million passengers traveled through the airport. The airport was established as Naval Air Station Sanford in 1942 and was utilized by the United States Navy until 1969. That year, the city of Sanford took control of the airport and renamed it Sanford Airport. For the next 25 years, the airport was primarily used for general aviation. In the mid-1990s, a new passenger terminal designed for jet airliners was constructed, marking the beginning of commercial flights to the airport. Since then, the airport has undergone various improvements. Today, Allegiant Air operates the majority of flights from the airport, offering destinations across the country. Both the MSFS 20/24 and X-Plane 12 versions of Orlando Sanford International Airport feature an accurate depiction of the airport, realistic buildings, and a variety of other features to make it as realistic as possible. The MSFS 20/24 version of the airport is priced at roughly $17.95 on SimMarket, while the X-Plane 12 version is available on SimMarket for approximately $19.49. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold!

entry.title: COWS Previews DA-40XLS for MSFS
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. COWS recently previewed its upcoming aircraft on their YouTube channel - the DA40-XLS. This marks the second aircraft they have developed, after the DA42. The Austrian single-engine light aircraft is one of the most popular trainer aircraft, with over 2,200 DA40s produced. Based on the also successful DA20, Diamond Aircraft Industries designed a four-seat prototype, named DA40 Diamond Star.Â The COWS DA40 is based on the XLS version. Considered as a âdeluxeâ version,Â it features a G1000 glass cockpit with WAAS (Wide Area Augmentation System) capability, Garmin GDL69 datalink, and a TAS traffic alert system.Â Their rendition will feature custom-designed systems with interactive circuit breakers, EIS, and custom cylinder simulation. While the price and the release date for X-Plane 12 are still undisclosed, the developers have mentioned that they are targeting the release of FS20 and FS24 in early 2025.Â As always, Threshold will keep you updated with any news and updates about the COWS DA40-XLS! â Stay tuned to Threshold for more flight sim news and reviews! â

entry.title: iniBuilds Teases Liveries Launching with their A350
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. iniBuilds has released another teaser for their upcoming A350, showcasing the liveries that will be included at launch through a video shared on their social media. The video showcases six liveries belonging to airlines from around the world: Delta, Japan Airlines, Scandinavian Airlines, China Eastern Airlines, Lufthansa, and Emirates. This is in addition to Cathay Pacific, Iberia, and British Airways, which have also been teased previously. Highly anticipated, the iniBuilds A350 aims to become the first study-level A350 in Microsoft Flight Simulator. According to iniBuilds, the aircraft will feature detailed 3D cabins, a comprehensive flight attendant panel, custom terrain radar, and intricate system simulation. It also includes Navigraph integration, SimBrief import, complex maintenance simulation, and a multitude of failures and emergency situations. â The aircraft was originally scheduled for release in 2024, but its launch has been postponed to 2025 to ensure a "fantastic product at launch." Additionally, the aircraft will be available for both Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 and 2020, despite it being initially planned as an exclusive for the 2024 version. IniBuilds cited stability issues with Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 as the reason for this decision. Stay tuned to Threshold for additional updates on the iniBuilds A350, and more. Additionally, join our vibrant community on Discord! â

entry.title: Headwind Simulations Previews Custom Cockpit for Airbus A339X
entry.summary: Sim: MSFS20. Freeware developer Headwind Simulations has recently showcased a preview of the upcoming custom cockpit for its A339X project, in a video posted on the AviatorCro YouTube channel. Until now, the aircraft has had a cockpit based on the FlyByWire A32NX [...] According to Headwind, the footage presented does not feature a completely new model or a full A330 cockpit; however, it represents a significant improvement in quality. Several changes are immediately apparent, with the design and geometry of the main panel standing out as the most notable. It is no longer a "hybrid" between an A320 and an A330. Additionally, a third Multi-Function Control Display Unit (MCDU) has been added, and lighting controls have been fully integrated. Some systems have also been improved, such as adding the "north reference" feature, which allows for switching navigational reference from magnetic to true north. This update is Phase 1 and will not include a redesigned overhead panel, as that will be part of Phase 2. Headwind Simulations has also indicated that Phase 2 will be released once the necessary systems are in place.Â The update is scheduled for release in January 2025 and will be exclusive to Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 for the time being. â For additional updates on the Headwind Simulations A339X, and more, stay tuned to Threshold.Â Additionally, join our vibrant community on Discord!
